{"step_by_step_thinking": "Vitamin K is involved in the process of blood clotting. It is converted into its active form by an enzyme. Glutathione reductase is involved in the reduction of glutathione, not vitamin K. Pyruvate carboxylase is involved in gluconeogenesis, not in the regeneration of vitamin K. Dihydrofolate reductase is involved in the synthesis of tetrahydrofolate, not in the regeneration of vitamin K. Epoxide reductase is the enzyme that regenerates vitamin K from its epoxide form to its active form.", "answer_choice": "D"}
